intro: Sarcopus aberrans, commonly known as the variable sarcopus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellowish, often arranged in a dense cluster. Sarcopus aberrans is noted for its adaptability and resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
